PRIVACY STATEMENT
SECTION 1 - WHAT DO WE DO WITH YOUR INFORMATION?
When you purchase something from our store, as part of the buying and selling process, we collect the personal information you give us such as your name, address and email address.
        When you browse our store, we also automatically receive your computer’s internet protocol (IP) address in order to provide us with information that
        helps us learn about your browser and operating system.
        Email marketing (if applicable): With your permission, we may send you emails about our store, new products and other updates.
SECTION 2 - CONSENT
How do you get my consent?
When you provide us with personal information to complete a transaction, verify your credit card, place an order, arrange for a delivery or return a
        purchase, we imply that you consent to our collecting it and using it for that specific reason only.
        If we ask for your personal information for a secondary reason, like marketing, we will either ask you directly for your expressed consent, or provide
        you with an opportunity to say no.
        If after you opt-in, you change your mind, you may withdraw your consent for us to contact you, for the continued collection, use or disclosure of your
        ontinued collection, use or disclosure of your information, at anytime, by contacting us at
[email protected]
SECTION 3 - DISCLOSURE
We may disclose your personal information if we are required by law to do so or if you violate our Terms of Service.
SECTION 4 – Smile POS
Our store is hosted on Smile POS, LLC. They provide us with the online e-commerce platform that allows us to sell our products and services to you.
        Your data is stored through Smile POS’ data storage, databases and the general Smile POS application. They store your data on a secure server behind a firewall.

        Payment:

        Smile POS stores your credit card data. It is encrypted through the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS). Your purchase transaction data is stored only as long as is necessary to complete your purchase transaction. After that is complete, your purchase transaction information is deleted.
        All direct payment gateways adhere to the standards set by PCI-DSS as managed by the PCI Security Standards Council, which is a joint effort of brands like Visa, MasterCard, American Express and Discover.
        PCI-DSS requirements help ensure the secure handling of credit card information by our store and its service providers
SECTION 5 - THIRD-PARTY SERVICES
In general, the third-party providers used by us will only collect, use and disclose your information to the extent necessary to allow them to perform the services they provide to us.
        However, certain third-party service providers, such as payment gateways and other payment transaction processors, have their own privacy policies in respect to the information we are required to provide to them for your purchase-related transactions.
        For these providers, we recommend that you read their privacy policies so you can understand the manner in which your personal information will be handled by these providers.
        In particular, remember that certain providers may be located in or have facilities that are located a different jurisdiction than either you or us. So if you elect to proceed with a transaction that involves the services of a third-party service provider, then your information may become subject to the laws of the jurisdiction(s) in which that service provider or its facilities are located.
        As an example, if you are located in Canada and your transaction is processed by a payment gateway located in the United States, then your personal information used in completing that transaction may be subject to disclosure under United States legislation, including the Patriot Act.
        Once you leave our store’s website or are redirected to a third-party website or application, you are no longer governed by this Privacy Policy or our website’s Terms of Service.
Links:
        When you click on links on our store, they may direct you away from our site. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of other sites and encourage you to read their privacy statements.
SECTION 6 - SECURITY
To protect your personal information, we take reasonable precautions and follow industry best practices to make sure it is not inappropriately lost, misused, accessed, disclosed, altered or destroyed.
        If you provide us with your credit card information, the information is encrypted using secure socket layer technology (SSL) and stored with a AES-256 encryption. Although no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure, we follow all PCI-DSS requirements and implement additional generally accepted industry standards.
SECTION 7 - AGE OF CONSENT
By using this site, you represent that you are at least the age of majority in your state or province of residence, or that you are the age of majority in your state or province of residence and you have given us your consent to allow any of your minor dependents to use this site.
SECTION 8 - CHANGES TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY
We reserve the right to modify this privacy policy at any time, so please review it frequently. Changes and clarifications will take effect immediately upon their posting on the website. If we make material changes to this policy, we will notify you here that it has been updated, so that you are aware of what information we collect, how we use it, and under what circumstances, if any, we use and/or disclose it.
        If our store is acquired or merged with another company, your information may be transferred to the new owners so that we may continue to sell products to you.
QUESTIONS AND CONTACT INFORMATION
If you would like to: access, correct, amend or delete any personal information we have about you, register a complaint, or simply want more information contact our Privacy Compliance Officer at
[email protected]

Served with sticky rice, fresh vegetables and spicy tamarind sauce.
Light batter-fried squid stir fry with salted egg sauce, bell pepper, yellow onion, green onion, and garnish with cilantro served with steamed jasmine rice.
LUNCHEON SPECIAL 12.95
CHOICE of
CHICKEN, PORK, SHRIMP, BEEF
OR FRIED TOFU
(except
Greenish, Eggplant Tofu, and Vegetable Pad Thai)
Served with Steamed Jasmine Rice (except Pad Thai), a vegetable crispy roll and choice of "Soup of the day" or Salad (peanut or vinaigrette dressing)
Available on Monday - Saturday from 11 AM – 3 PM
Princess of Siam
Stir-fried mushrooms, onions, carrots and zucchini in homemade sauce.
Chili Basil 🌶️
Stir-fried fresh basil, carrots, bell peppers, green beans, onions and mushrooms in basil sauce.
Garlic and Pepper Lover
Stir-fried mushrooms in garlic and black pepper sauce served over fresh cabbages and garnished with cilantro.
Cashew Delight
Stir-fried meat with cashew nuts, carrots and onions in special sauce.
Taste of Ginger
Stir-fried fresh ginger, onions, carrots, mushrooms and celery in ginger sauce.
Chili Paste 🌶️
Stir-fried broccoli, basil leaves and onions in chili paste sauce.
Peanut Rama
Sautéed chicken with homemade peanut sauce, steamed mixed vegetables and green onions.
Red Curry 🌶️
Red curry paste, coconut milk, bamboo shoots, peas, carrots and basil.
Yellow Curry 🌶️
Southern Thai style yellow curry paste in coconut milk firm cube potatoes, carrots and red onions.
Green Curry 🌶️
Green curry, coconut milk, bamboo shoots, zucchini, peas and basil.
Chicken Teriyaki
Grilled marinated chicken breast with teriyaki sauce, served with steamed mixed vegetables. (Not available for other protein substitute)
Pad Thai
The oriental Thai noodles creation with green onions, baked tofu, bean sprouts and egg in special sauce. Served with crushed peanuts and lime.
Sweet and Sour
Thai style sautéed cucumbers, onions, tomatoes and pineapples.
Royal Broccoli
Fresh broccoli sautéed in gravy sauce.
Green Dish
A perfect vegetable dish with combination of vegetables, mushrooms, bean sprouts, and fried tofu stir-fried with soy sauce. (available for other protein substitute)
Eggplant Tofu 🌶️
Stir-fried eggplants and fried tofu with broccoli, bell peppers, and fresh basil in spicy basil sauce. (available for other protein substitute)
Vegetable Pad Thai
Thai noodles creation with broccoli, onions, carrots, baked tofu and bean sprout in a special sauce. Served with crushed peanuts and lime.
Substitution :

About the Business
Me’Khun Delicacies brings the authentic taste of Thailand to Katy, Texas. We specialize in fresh, flavorful Thai dishes, from appetizers, classic salads, curries, and stir-fries to unique specialties. Whether you’re dining in or ordering takeout, we aim to provide a warm and welcoming atmosphere with every bite. Discover the bold flavors of Thailand with our carefully crafted menu, which is perfect for those seeking an unforgettable dining experience.

Dinner is $149 per person • Indigenous Wine & Cocktail Pairing $129 • 20% Service Charge • Gratuity Optional • Reservations Required
Our Menu & Timeline
Please be sure to advise us of any dietary restrictions or requests in as much time as possible prior to your reservations. Sorry, but because of the enormous amount of preparation and ingredient sourcing, we are unable to accommodate requests made on the day of your dining experience.

Pho Ben Sugar Land ~ First Colony Menu
Our menu respects traditional Vietnamese food flavors with modern influences. Please note that pricing is subject to change.
Appetizers

APPETIZERS
(KHAI VỊ)
All spring rolls are made with your choice of protein, rice vermicelli noodles, fresh lettuce, and bean sprouts, delicately wrapped in thin white rice paper. Served with a side of peanut sauce. Each order comes with 2 pieces. Add shrimp to any non-shrimp spring roll for $2.00.
1. Vietnamese Egg Rolls (2 pcs) | Chả Giò – $5.25
A savory blend of pork, prawns, mushrooms, and vegetables Seasons with aromatic spices, wrapped and fried crispy golden-brown rice paper. Served with fresh lettuce, pickled carrots and daikon, and a side of fish sauce
2. Fresh Spring Rolls (2 pcs) | Gỏi Cuốn – $5.25
Light and refreshing with thinly sliced steamed Vietnamese pork and shrimp
3. Fresh Tofu Spring Rolls (2 pcs) | Gỏi Cuốn Đậu Hủ – $5.25
Lightly fried tofu
4. Grilled Pork Spring Rolls (2 pcs) | Gỏi Cuốn Thịt Nướng – $6.00
Flavorful lemongrass-marinated, char-grilled pork
5. Grilled Chicken Spring Rolls (2 pcs) | Gỏi Cuốn Gà Nướng – $6.00
Flavorful lemongrass-marinated, char-grilled chicken
6. Grilled Beef Spring Rolls (2 pcs) |  Gỏi Cuốn Bò Nướng – $6.00
Flavorful lemongrass-marinated, char-grilled beef
SANDWICHES
(BÁNH MÌ)
Each Vietnamese sandwich is prepared with butter, cucumbers, cilantro, jalapenos, and pickled carrots & daikon served in a crispy French baguette.
Add-ons: Pâté $0.75 | Fried Egg $1.50
9. Vietnamese Special Sandwich | Bánh Mì Đặc Biệt $6.50
A cold-cut sandwich that comes with pate, pork roll, steamed pork, and our signature toppings.
10. Pork Sandwich | Bánh Mì Thịt Nướng – $6.50
Tinder lemongrass char-grilled pork with our signature toppings
11. Chicken Sandwich | Bánh Mì Gà Nướng – $6.50
Tinder lemongrass char-grilled chicken with our signature toppings
12. Beef Sandwich | Bánh Mì Bò Nướng – $7.00
Tinder lemongrass char-grilled beef with our signature toppings
NOODLE SOUP
(PHỞ)
Served with a fresh plate of bean sprouts, lime wedges, basil, cilantro, and sliced jalapenos. Beef soups feature a rich beef broth and chicken soups highlight a delicate chicken broth. The beef we offer include eye of round steak, lean and fatty brisket, well-done flank, soft tendon, white tripe, skirt flank, and beef meatballs.
Small $11.00 | Large $12.00

Menus
Play video
Pause video
OFFERINGS
Fall Tasting Menu
Celebrate the season with our new Fall Tasting Menu - a curated culinary journey featuring Nobu signatures and seasonal creations like our Chef's Sushi Selection and Beef Tenderloin with Seared Foie Gras, Maitake Puree, and Fig Demi. Priced at $130 per guest, this thoughtfully composed menu captures the essence of fall and is perfect for both first-time and return guests.
RESERVE
INTRODUCING
SUNDAY BRUNCH
Indulge in an exceptional brunch experience at Nobu, curated by our executive culinary team, bringing together a generous selection of Japanese and western delights. Enjoy with friends and family on a journey of unlimited Nobu favorites, sushi, salads, pastries and desserts, as well as Chef stations and live DJ entertainment. Don't forget to check out our brunch cocktail specials to complete your experience.
RESERVE
RESERVE NOW
Nobu at the sushi bar
Join us for Nobu "At the Sushi Bar" every Thursday and Friday. During this immersive omakase, our Chef will guide you through a curated selection from the sushi bar with traditional and Nobu signature flavors.
The 17-course menu is $225 per person + tax. There is an optional champagne and sake pairing available for an additional $70 + tax. Seatings take place at 7pm and are limited to 4 guests.
Reserve
Happening
Tanoshi Hours
Join us for Tanoshi Hours to experience Nobu signature cocktails with curated bar bites.
Monday to Sunday from 5pm to 7pm
VIEW MENU
Secrets from the Kitchen
If you are dining at Nobu for the first time, the chef recommends trying 3 or more of the menu's "Eight Highlights." The best way to enjoy this experience is to start with 2 or 3 cold dishes; then move on to 2 or 3 hot ones. Finally, end with some sushi and dessert. All of these dishes are shared family style.
Here are some of the recommendations:
As a palate opener:
Yellowtail Jalapeno
Delicately sliced yellowtail sashimi with touches of garlic puree, adorned with jalapeno slices then crowned with cilantro and served with Japanese citrus soy sauce; 6 pieces in one order. The cilantro elevates every bite, enhancing the flavor.
For Salad:
Sashimi Salad Matsuhisa Dressing
7 pieces of rare grilled tuna sashimi salad sprinkled with black pepper on a a bed of field greens and served with Nobu Matsuhisa signature onion soy dressing.
For Hot Dishes:
Rock Shrimp Tempura Creamy Spicy
Handful of battered shrimp "Tempura-ed" tossed with creamy spicy sauce, flavored with yuzu juice and pieces of shiitake mushrooms,  served over a bed of greens drizzled with yuzu dressing. Best enjoyed together with the greens.
Black Cod Miso
Filet of black cod marinated in Den miso sauce for a few days then baked in oven and finished with a salamander broil.
Show more

About the Business
Sunray Pasta is a distinctive Italian-Asian fusion restaurant owned by WATTANEE, a passionate restaurateur from Thailand. Blending the rich culinary traditions of Italy with bold international flavors, the restaurant offers a unique menu that combines the authenticity of classic Italian dishes with vibrant Asian influences. All meats are prepared using Halal-certified ingredients, ensuring inclusivity and quality. Signature dishes include fusion pasta creations with an Asian twist, all crafted from fresh, locally sourced ingredients. As a woman-owned business, Sunray Pasta is dedicated to delivering exceptional service, a warm and welcoming atmosphere, and unforgettable dining experiences

HAPPY HOUR
Sunday–Thursday 5:00–6:00 PM, all day Monday
MONDAY - $6 sparkling wine by the glass
$1.25 Oysters* (GF) - Six Chesapeake Bay oysters on the half shell with Thai chile mignonette - $7.50
Hanoi Whole Grilled Fish (GF) - Branzino marinated 24 hours in yogurt and turmeric, topped with a dill and shallot chimichurri salad - $30
TUESDAY - Beer and patio cocktail  specials
TBG Cheeseburger - 5oz char-grilled short rib patty, miso butter onions, white American cheese, house-made pickles, Sriracha mayo, toasted challah bun. Served with a side of crispy thin-cut fries. $16
WEDNESDAY - 25% off all whiskeys
Vietnamese Steak & Egg* - Our popular Bò Né (or Dodge the Beef) is back! Sliced hanger steak served on a sizzling skillet with garlic butter, caramelized onions, Vietnamese pork pâté, fried egg, and baguette bread to mop up all the goodness. - $26
THURSDAY - 25% off wines by the glass
Ribs & Frites $25 - Half-rack of our xá xíu sticky ribs slow-cooked for 24 hours in a sweet and savory glaze of honey, hoisin & five-spice. Served with a side of crispy thin-cut fries.
All daily specials are for dine-in only.
Book a reservation today
.
FOOD
Oysters with Thai Chile Mignonette* (GF) $7.50
Six Chesapeake Bay oysters on the half shell, shallot, Vietnamese herbs, citrus
Mom’s Eggrolls $5
Two rolls with pork, shrimp, carrot, wood ear mushroom. Comes with lettuce and herbs for wrapping, fish sauce vinaigrette for dipping.
Thịt Kho Dumplings $7
Six fried dumplings stuffed with pork belly braised in coconut juice, garlic, and fish sauce. Served with a soy vinaigrette for dipping.
Pork Belly Skewers (gluten-free) $7
Two grilled skewers flavored with a lemongrass fish sauce glaze
Crispy Parmesan Fries (V) $8
Perfect for sharing and snacking, lightly seasoned thin-cut fries are dusted with parmesan and chives. Served with our signature scallion mayo and classic ketchup.
Bánh Khọt (GF) $8
Six mini crispy cakes made with turmeric and coconut milk, topped with shrimp and scallion oil. Served with lettuce and herbs for wrapping, fish sauce vinaigrette for dipping.
Sticky Wings (gluten-free) $10
Six wings with fish sauce glaze, garlic, lime, Thai chile, Vietnamese herbs
DRINKS $6
HiBall
Japanese whisky, Topo Chico, lemon
Old Fashioned
Your choice of bourbon or rye whiskey, turbinado, Angostura bitters
Margarita
Your choice of blanco tequila or mezcal, lime, Curacao, salt
Bramble
Your choice of gin or vodka, lemon, cassis
Negroni
Gin, Campari, sweet vermouth
Daiquiri
White rum, lime, turbinado
Dinner
LITTLE WOMEN - Small Dishes
“…make each day both useful and pleasant, and prove that you understand the worth of time by employing it well. Then youth will bring few regrets, and life will become a beautiful success.”
Salmon Crudo* (GF) $15
Pear, scallion, citrus and ginger ponzu, crispy rice vermicelli
Oysters with Thai Chile Mignonette* (GF) $18
Six oysters on the half shell, shallot, Vietnamese herbs, citrus
Crispy Parmesan Fries
(V) $10
Perfect for sharing and snacking, lightly seasoned thin-cut fries are dusted with parmesan and chives. Served with our signature scallion mayo and classic ketchup.
Tofu Spring Rolls (V) $7
Two rolls with crispy tofu, toasted coconut, fresh herbs, tamarind peanut sauce for dipping. Can be made vegan and gluten-free upon request.
Mom’s Eggrolls $9.50
Chef Christine’s childhood favorite with pork, shrimp, carrot, wood ear mushroom. Comes with lettuce and herbs for wrapping, fish sauce vinaigrette for dipping.
Thịt Kho Dumplings $12
Taste Chef Christine’s winning MasterChef entrée in dumpling form—six fried dumplings stuffed with pork belly braised in coconut juice, garlic, and fish sauce. Served with a soy vinaigrette for dipping.
Tôm Toast $10
Crispy shrimp toast with chives and the famous Nha Trang crab sauce (if you know, you know)
Pork Belly Skewers (GF) $9
Two grilled skewers flavored with a lemongrass fish sauce glaze
THE GREAT GATSBY - Medium Dishes
“…tomorrow we will run faster, stretch out our arms farther...And so we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.”
Beef carpaccio (Bò Tái Chanh)* (GF) $16
Thinly sliced beef steak, roasted garlic and tamari vinaigrette, Vietnamese herbs, pickled shallot, roasted peanuts, fried onion, seasoned sesame crackers
Bánh Khọt (GF) $13
Six mini crispy cakes made with turmeric and coconut milk, topped with shrimp and scallion oil. Served with lettuce and herbs for wrapping, fish sauce vinaigrette for dipping.
Sticky Wings (GF) $14
Six wings with fish sauce glaze, garlic, lime, Thai chile, Vietnamese herbs
Blistered Beans (VV) $10
Wok-fried green beans with garlic, shallot, and toasted sesame
Coconut Curry Mussels $16
Shallot, ginger, lemongrass, lime, Thai basil, toasted baguette slices
Caramelized Salmon (Cá Kho) $26
Braised in shallot, garlic, and fish sauce and served with jasmine rice, this is a salmon version of the clay pot catfish Chef Christine cooked during her MasterChef audition that earned her a white apron. Taste the flavors that made Gordon Ramsay say yes!
Vietnamese Chicken Curry (GF) $20
Yellow curry with lemongrass, coconut milk, potato, mirepoix purée, cilantro, side of jasmine rice
Grilled Steak with Green Curry Sauce* (GF) $25
Hanger steak sliced to share, green Thai chiles, cilantro, Thai basil, lemongrass, coconut milk.
Dduk au Beurre Blanc (V, GF) $16
Korean sticky rice cakes with gochujang beurre blanc, browned butter mushrooms, freshly grated Parmesan, black pepper, chives
Goat Express Lo Mein (V) **NEW**
$14
A nod to the popular dish found on every Chinese-American takeout menu, our version is made with stir-fried egg noodles, Chinese broccoli, carrot, onion, cabbage, and cilantro. Add chicken +$5, shrimp +$6, or tofu +$4.
Texas BBQ Brisket Fried Rice (GF) $19
Egg and ketchup fried rice with smoked brisket
Shrimp Fried Rice (GF) $13
Egg and ketchup fried rice with shrimp
Egg Fried Rice (V, GF) $10
A vegetarian version of our ketchup fried rice
THE BFG - Large Dishes
“‘We is in Dream Country,’ the BFG said. ‘This is where all dreams is beginning.’”
Hanoi Grilled Turmeric Fish (GF) $45
A whole branzino inspired by one of Chef Christine’s late father’s favorite dishes, chả cá lã vọng. Marinated in yogurt with turmeric, garlic, ginger, and lime. Topped with a dill and shallot chimichurri salad. The Vietnamese believe it’s lucky to eat whole fish, so eat this, then go buy a lottery ticket.
Puffed Rice Noodles with Tofu (VV) $16
Pillows of crispy rice noodles, stir-fried vegetables, tamari, Maggi
Crawfish & Garlic Noodles $20
Lots of butter, crawfish tails, Chinese egg noodles, freshly grated parmesan, lemon zest.
LIFE OF PI - Sweets
“It is true that those we meet can change us, sometimes so profoundly that we are not the same afterwards…”
Basque Burnt Cheesecake (V) $12
Phở-spiced poached pear, Biscoff crumble
Coconut Pandan Tres Leches (V)  $12
The beloved Mexican dessert with a Vietnamese twist, topped with whipped coconut custard, strawberries, and toasted coconut
Rubbish Apple Pie à la Mode $12
Christine’s famous pie praised by Gordon Ramsay, but with a Vietnamese twist—star anise, ginger, lemongrass.
*Consuming raw or undercooked meats or eggs may increase your risk of food-borne illness.
V - vegetarian
VV - vegan
Drinks
COCKTAILS
Zen Garden Spritz $14
Bright and floral—St-Germain, lychee, jasmine, sparkling wine, Topo Chico
Mount Fuji Mist $13
A light, refreshing highball with a hint of umami—dry sake, yuzu, honey, Topo Chico
Old Fashioned Tea Ceremony $17
Japanese Toki whisky infused with jasmine tea leaves, honey, ginger bitters. Finished with a smoked rosemary sprig.
Gochujang Paloma $13
A Korean twist on the refreshing Mexican cocktail—tequila, grapefruit, Topo Chico, and a touch of that unmistakable sweet and savory red pepper paste
Mexican Mango-tini $14
Blanco tequila, clarified mango cordial, grapefruit, finished with a hint of chile oil
Summer in Siam $15
Cucumber habañero tequila, watermelon, strawberry, Thai chile, ginger, lime, topped with cucumber foam
Matcha-tini $14
Roku Japanese gin, Suntori Haku Japanese vodka, matcha powder, pandan
Saigonberry Sour $14
We’re the first establishment in Houston to bring you Sông Cái gin, Vietnam’s first gin distillery. Crafted with fresh blueberries, elderflower, lemongrass, lavender.
Breakfast of Champions $14
Stay young at heart with this cereal milk turned cocktail—Flor de Caña white rum, Fruity Pebbles-infused clarified milk wash, Aperol, lemon, pineapple. Topped with a marshmallow foam and cereal sprinkle.
Pandan Chillada (frozen) $13
A fun twist on a piña colada with Coconut rum, soju, house-made pandan syrup, coconut milk, pineapple, and lime
Hibiscus Mezcal’rita (frozen) $13
Rosaluna mezcal, lemon, orange bitters. Finished with a cinnamon stick smoked tableside.
MOCKTAILS
Cool-as-a-Cucumber Christian $9
Pineapple, lemon, cucumber, ginger, Thai chile, Topo Chico
Play It Smart Alec $9
House-made lemongrass syrup, Topo Chico, fresh-squeezed lime juice
Flower Power $10
Hibiscus, lemon, rose syrup, Topo Chico, jasmine tea floater
CANNABIS NON-ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES
4:20 Margarita (5mg) $10
Ocho Verde agave cannabis spirit, prickly pear, lime, orange. Served on the rocks.
Beach Break Swell Berry (5mg) $12
Beach Break Watermelon (5mg) $12
oHHo Pink Grapefruit Elderflower (5mg) $11
High Rise Pineapple (5mg) $9
BEERS
Hanoi Vietnamese Lager $6
Kirin Ichiban $5
Kirin Light $5
Hitachino Nest White Ale $10
Lucky Brew, Lucky Dog Session India pale ale $11
SAKE
Dassai, Blue Type 50 Yamada - Nishiki Junmai Daiginjo (750 ml) $50
Aromas of cantaloupe, Fuji apple, lemon candy, and anise for a bright and lively drinking experience
Kikusui Shuzo, Junmai Ginjo (300 ml) $20
Medium-bodied and smooth with layered aromas of yogurt, sesame seeds, and mandarin oranges
Kikusui Shuzo, Funaguchi Ichiban Shibori (200 ml can) $12
Japan's first Nama-Sake. Unpasteurized and undiluted for a fruity aroma and fresh full-bodied flavor with 19% alcohol content.
Uchigasaki, Michinoku Onikoroshi Honjozo (300 ml) $20
"Demon Slayer" signifies that the sake is dry enough to kill a demon. Subtle aromas of minerals and grains with light yet sharp texture and a rich umami flavor.
Kiku Masamune Shuzo, Kinushiro Junmai Nigori White Silk (500 ml) $25
Subtle aromas of coconut and steamed rice. Silky soft texture with a gentle sweetness.
Suigei Shuzo, Drunken Whale Tokubetsu Junmai (300 ml) $23
Soft aromas of tart fruits and wildflowers. Clean and crisp texture with a bright, dry finish lingering of umami.
SPARKLING WINE
La Farra -
Prosecco Brut - Veneto, Italy
$11 | $40
Slightly sweet sparkling with refreshing crisp florals

Sparkling Rosé - Acampo, California
$12 | $42
A fun naturally made fizzy red Zinfandel. Mostly dry with red apple and floral spice.

Penedès, Catalonia, Spain
$10 | $35
Organically grown dry sparkling with brioche and apple notes
WHITE WINE

Hungary
$10 | $35
Dry and full-bodied version of freshness from the famous Unesco World Heritage site
Limnos Savvoglou Tsivolas Assytiko -
Limnos, Greece
$16 | $58
Ancient grape grown on Aristotle’s favorite volcanic island, kissed by the Aegean sea breeze
Colterenzio Pinot Grigio -
Alto Adige, Italy
$12 | $42
White peach, green apple and Alpine herbs with vibrant acidity
Ch la Rose du Pin - Sauvignon Blanc -
Bordeaux, France

The original sauvignon blanc. Zesty lime and lychee with rounded edges.
Karl Schaefer -

Traditional off-dry slate and white peach that lingers with Bosc pear
Ciavolich Aries Pecorino Colline Pescaresi IGP -

Grown on the picturesque coast of the Adriatic, with eﬀervescent tastes of orchard fruits and ocean air

Just a touch of oak and butter from this historic region
ROSÉ WINE

Slovenia

Crafted with 46 days of skin contact and aged two years in neutral oak

Rich in strawberry, a light easy drinking rose from central Spain

Very light pink rosé with a lovely Provencial airiness
RED WINE

Bright blue and purple fruit from high up in the Andes

Showcases the grape’s pure, mineral-driven character in a vibrant, medium-bodied wine with fresh dark fruit and balanced acidity

Bold mocha cherries and dusty tannins

Medium-bodied red with ripe blackberry and plum flavors, earthy spice, and a touch of Dalmatian herbs
Aniello -

$12 | $42
Light balance of berries and earth grown amongst unexplored nature
Font Du Loup Chateauneuf Du Pape -
‘Les Demoiselles’ - France
$20 | $70
Elegance and complexity, bursting with vibrant red and black fruits, aromatic garrigue herbs, and layers of spice, all woven into a silky, luxurious texture with a lingering, captivating finish—truly a wine that rewards both now and with time

Greenway Coffee’s Mid-Century blend dark roast beans with notes of chocolate, cinnamon, and vanilla. Served over ice with sweetened condensed milk.

About the Business
Agnes and Sherman is a modern Asian American diner all about comfort food in a modern cozy setting. Located in the Heights neighborhood of Houston, you can expect scallion waffles, a Chinese BBQ club sandwich, crab rangoon, and more delights. To go with your meal, enjoy Asian American cocktails, zero proof drinks, a playfully classic wine list, and desserts that are not too sweet. 

The team is led by Chef Nick Wong and Managing Partner Lisa Lee, who believe in creating a culture of belonging and community through food. Walk-ins, kids, solo diners, large groups, and service animals are welcome, and parking is plentiful in the neighborhood. Reservations can be made through OpenTable. We hope to see you soon!
…

Pho Town is a Vietnamese Noodle - Grill - Roll restaurant that locates on FM1960 and Jones Rd. in Houston. Texas.  Pho Town have the best beef noodle soup, grilled beef and seafood rice plates and rolls.  All dishes is made from natural and organinc ingredient.  ....NO MSG.. Come and check it out. Top of Page
About
Wisdom
Menus
C
VIETNAMESE BASED CUISINE , FU-ZION, & THEN SOME...BYOB
SOUPS
Our Pho ("fuh") is the our own FU style Vietnamese rice noodle soup that is stewed for hours overnight, & is savory and delicious to the last drop. We also have our Hot n Mild spiced Dumpling egg noodle soup that will not disappoint.
NOODLES
From our Thai inspired Phat Thai to Stir Fu lo mein noodles, or dry ramen noodle stir fry, you have several noodles dishes here to try out! Enjoy!
SHAR-EDIBLES
Our yummy appetizers are some of our family favorites & are meant to be shared. We hope you enjoy our homemade crispy Flying Eggrolls and Crabby Cream rolls. Not to
mention OUR Wings!
Lunch Specials
Everyday from 11:15-2:15 pm
L1 Eloisa’s House Fried Rice
L2 Bergen BBQ Pork Fried Rice
L3 Stir Fu Manoodles
L4 Beef Vermicelli Boom Cha Y’all
L4C Chicken Vermicelli Boom Ch Y’all
L6 Phat Thai
L7 Chicha-Currylish
L10 Veggie Fried Rice
L11 Broke A$$ Ramen
L13 Basil Beef Stir Fry
L13C Basil chicken Stir Fry
​
*Dine In Only *
SEE MENU
Menus
Chef Taylor Chung's story
Taylor and his wife, along with two young daughters left Vietnam in the middle of the night on a fisherman's boat, in search of freedom. They left behind their youngest daughter, who was only 11 months old and severely sick with her grandmother. After being chased while dodging pirate ships, throwing the deceased overboard, and bailing water out from the leaks under the boat, they hit the sandy beaches of Phillipines after several days out at sea. They looked up into the clear blue skies and just gave thanks to whomever was watching out for them. That whomever was God, who they later received as their personal Saviour while stationed at the refugee camp. After some time at 2 different refugee camps, they were sponsored by an old friend to Oklahoma. Four months later, they were able to save enough money from lawn mowing jobs to buy a used car. Taylor drove his family up to Ames, Iowa, where they met up with some friends who were on the same boat. Ames became their home for the next 30 years. Eleven years after his departure from Vietnam, their youngest daughter reunited with them in Ames. Fast forward, all their children grew up and became successful in their post college careers, and Taylor and his wife became empty nesters. Taylor has always had a passion for cooking, as he has cooked for all the Vietnamese Christian church conferences and special events. So they decided to pick up and move south to warmer Texas, to get away from the cold winters with the hope and dream of opening their own little restaurant to share their favorite meals. Hence, after one year of exploring Houston and making it their new home, Fu Manchung was born.
As of 9/1/2023, new ownership will take over as Chef Taylor retires after six years at the kitchen helm here. We would sincerely like to thank all that have passed through and for your local small business support over the years. The new owners, are also a small family with the same dream we had years ago of owning a small family ran restaurant. We leave the original stories of the owners here so that you can understand how Fu Manchung came to life.
Lets welcome the new owners, with a grace filled heart and continue to support family local businesses all around. The name and menu will stay intact for the most part, and we wish y'all many blessings in this life's journey.
Love,
Chef Taylor & Paul
Paul's story
Born and raised in Des Moines, Iowa, Paul always dreamed of doing many things in life. He graduated from the University of Iowa with a B.S. degree in Management Information Systems and worked for 10 years at a life insurance company doing mainframe programming, developing databases, and wrapped up his corporate career as an Information Systems Resource Manager. One day he decided to leave and pursue wedding photography. Not knowing a thing about cameras or wedding portraits, he shadowed Taylor for a year, who was his mentor, and eventually would soon become his father in-law. It was through this chapter that he was able to express his art and creativity through documenting and capturing life's moments. Once he accomplished this challenge, it was time to move on to another challenge of running his own restaurant some day as he loves to eat, who doesn't? This is where the current chapter is being written and taking on a new path for the next few years. Paul knew Taylor had a passion for cooking, from endless family gatherings to many church conference events, so Paul asked him if he'd like to partner up. They both packed up and moved south to Texas and will be bringing their family favorite dishes to share with this community. We have never ran or owned a restaurant before, so you are now a part of this new chapter and journey ahead with us. We are grateful and thankful to each of you and your support! Share a smile today. Blessings.

Our Menu
Are you in the mood for Mediterranean delights? Dive into our menu, where the
rich flavors of Mediterranean
, Lebanese, and Greek cuisines come alive in Houston!
Order Online
1 EntrÉe + 3 Sides
$17.99
1 Entrée + 2 Sides
$16.99
4 VEGGIE SIDES
$16.99
Steak Filet Beef Kabob Platter
Steak Filet Beef Kabob + Rice + 2 Sides
$21.99
Lamb Filet Kabob Platter
Lamb Filet Kabob + Rice + 2 Sides
$21.99
Lamb sHANK Platter
Lamb Shank + Rice + 2 Sides
$24.99
Start Crafting Your PLate
SEE ALL OUR DISHES
FULL MENU
EntrÉes
Entrées & Kabobs
Classic Chicken Kebab
Succulent chicken thighs marinated in traditional Lebanese spices, onion, garlic and olive oil. Served skewered and char grilled to perfection.
ORDER NOW
Baked Chicken Quarter
Tender and juicy chicken quarter (bone-in) seasoned with herbs and spices and baked until golden and crispy.
ORDER NOW
Saffron Chicken Kebab
Tender chicken breast cubes marinated in saffron, onions, garlic, and Mediterranean seasoning. Vibrant with unique flavors.
ORDER NOW
Filet Beef Steak Kabob
Premium filet steak cubes marinated in olive oil, onion, and light seasoning to highlight the natural flavor of this prime beef cut.
ORDER NOW
Curry Chicken
Succulent chicken breast cubes, carrots, and marrow cooked in mild, aromatic sauce.
ORDER NOW
Chipotle Chicken Kebab
Chipotle chicken Kebab juicy white chicken pieces marinated in spicy chipotle sauce and Turkish spices, then chargrilled for a smoky kick.
ORDER NOW
Lamb Gyro
Slow-cooked, lamb strips prepared on a vertical rotisserie, brushed regularly with an aromatic marinate for extra smokiness. (Plated, excluding wrap)
ORDER NOW
Filet Lamb Kabob
Premium filet steak cubes marinated in olive oil, onion, and light seasoning to highlight the natural flavor of this prime beef cut.
ORDER NOW
Spicy Lamb Meatballs
Gluten-free lamb meatballs simmered in our signature sweet-spicy chipotle gravy, delivering a smoky kick with every tender bite.
ORDER NOW
Lamb Shank
Ten-hour braised lamb shank—fall-off-the-bone tender, rich with spices; hailed as Houston’s best and among the world’s finest.
ORDER NOW
Kafta Kabob
Minced beef, onion, parsley, and Middle Eastern spices formed around skewers and char-grilled to perfection.
ORDER NOW
Side Dishes
Salads
Orzo Pesto Salad
Tender orzo in nut-free pesto with olives, feta, and cherry tomatoes.
ORDER NOW
Lebanese Salad
Garden fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, parsley, red onions, red bell peppers, and mint, tossed with olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, and sumac dressing.
ORDER NOW
Mushroom Salad
Mushrooms and artichokes tossed in Italian dressing with grilled squash and carrots.
ORDER NOW
Cabbage Salad
Crisp red and green cabbage tossed with fresh mint, garlic, lemon juice, and olive oil.
ORDER NOW
House Greek Salad
A bold, fresh mix of tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, Kalamata olives, and crumbled feta cheese. Tossed in olive oil, oregano, and topped with pepperoncini and pickled jalapeños.
ORDER NOW
CharGrilled Veggies
Fresh carrots, squash, and zucchini, marinated in garlic, lemon, and Mediterranean spices, then char-grilled for bold flavor.
ORDER NOW
Spinach Feta Salad
Spinach Feta Salad, featuring spinach, mushrooms, red onions, and bell peppers, tossed with a tangy Greek vinaigrette.
ORDER NOW
Tabbouleh Salad
A vibrant mix of parsley, bulgur wheat, tomatoes, onions, and mint, tossed in a bright lemon-olive oil dressing—contains gluten.
ORDER NOW
Creamy Pasta Salad
Hearty penne pasta with fresh spinach, veggies, and a creamy Italian herbed aioli, brightened with oregano and citrus.
ORDER NOW
Beet & Jicama Salad
Chilled beets and crunchy jicama tossed in a zesty orange-glazed vinaigrette. Light, citrusy, and refreshing.
ORDER NOW
Chickpea Salad
Tender chickpeas tossed with tomatoes, onion, cilantro, and a tangy vinaigrette. Hearty, fresh, and vegan.
ORDER NOW
Fattoush Salad
Crispy pita chips tossed with fresh lettuce, vegetables, mint, and parsley in a zesty lemon-sumac vinaigrette dressing.
ORDER NOW
Quinoa Salad
A nutrient-rich, colorful salad featuring fluffy quinoa, crisp vegetables, creamy feta, and Kalamata olives, complemented by a zesty orange vinaigrette.
ORDER NOW
Lentil Salad
Protein-rich green lentils tossed with tomatoes, cilantro, onions, and a tangy herb vinaigrette. Hearty, vegan, and gluten-free.
ORDER NOW
Hot Vegetables
Lemon Cilantro Roasted Potatoes
Crispy oven-roasted potatoes tossed in citrusy lemon, aromatic garlic, and chopped cilantro—a light, flavorful side that’s plant-based and gluten-free.
ORDER NOW
Lemon Cilantro squash
A vibrant and zesty dish prepared with sliced squash, mushrooms and zucchini, sauteed with fresh lemon juice, garlic and cilantro.
ORDER NOW
Roasted Cauliflower
Tender cauliflower florets caramelized to bring out their natural sweetness and earthy flavor. A simple, healthy favorite perfect for Houston catering and Mediterranean menus.
ORDER NOW
Baked Mashed Potato
Mashed potatoes and mozzarella wrapped around cream cheese, breaded and baked with paprika and breadcrumbs. Iconic Aladdin favorite.
ORDER NOW
Fried Okra
Fresh okra slices, breaded and fried to golden perfection. A crispy, vegetarian Mediterranean side at Aladdin Catering in Montrose, Houston.
ORDER NOW
Almond Vermicelli Rice
Long-grain rice with toasted vermicelli, Ocean Spray dried cranberries, and slivered almonds for a light sweet crunch.
ORDER NOW
Saffron Rice
Long-grain rice simmered with saffron, cardamom, bay leaf, peas, and carrots for a fragrant golden finish.
ORDER NOW
Dips
Classic Hummus
Classic Hummus — Creamy chickpea and tahini dip with garlic and lemon. Made fresh daily—vegan, gluten-free, nut-free, and dairy-free.
ORDER NOW
Caramelized Onion Hummus
Creamy hummus blended with sweet caramelized onions. A savory, rich dip that pairs perfectly with pita or vegetables.
ORDER NOW
Spinach Hummus
Fresh spinach blended into classic hummus. Vegan, gluten-free, and perfect with our warm pita. Made daily at Aladdin Mediterranean Grill, Houston.
ORDER NOW
Spicy Hummus
Our fiery twist on classic hummus infused with fresh jalapenos peppers topped with olive oil and paprika.
ORDER NOW
Baba Ganoush
Smooth, smoky dip made with fire-roasted eggplant, tahini, garlic, lemon, and premium extra virgin olive oil.
ORDER NOW
Garlic Dip
A robust and creamy dairy-based dip packed with crushed garlic and olive oil. Variations include yogurt and cream.
ORDER NOW
Visit Us Today
Join us at our Montrose or Garden Oaks locations for a delightful dining experience. Our doors are open, welcoming you to enjoy the best Mediterranean food in Houston.

Can’t afford a vacation to the isles? This tropical destination is one hell of a consolation prize. Sip cheekily named cocktails like the Resting Beach Face, a mix of jalapeno-infused tequila, orange, lime, cassis, and overproof rum, and soak up all those umbrella drinks with tater tots drenched in spicy Sichuan pepper sauce.
Houston’s 14 Best New Cocktail Bars.
Jan 20
Located in the heart of Montrose on Richmond Avenue, folks will find classic tiki drinks aplenty as well as many new concoctions that pair tropical fruits with lighter spirits.
Opened in 2019 by husband and wife team Martin and Sara Stayer of Nobie’s Restaurant fame, this tropical beach outpost in Montrose has been churning out innovative cocktails from award-winning bar director Sarah Troxell and amazing bar bites from chef de cuisine Ben Ruiz since flinging open their doors to the tiki-loving masses.
Say aloha and stay awhile while enjoying low-ABV libations including the unforgettable Vamos a la Playa which comes served up with mezcal, Mexican rum, pineapple shrub, and lime; or the unique and savory Sandy Banana that’s made with rye whiskey, peanut, banana, and citrus; or the namesake Toasted Coconut which comes frozen with aged rum, toasted coconut, and citrus.
Don’t forget about the food, though. If you work up an appetite sipping the night away, try bites like coconut shrimp skewers, mapo tofu tater tots, Thai crispy rice and napa salad, or masa dumplings with salsa verde and a fried egg.
Enjoy tiki-inspired food & cocktails at The Toasted Coconut in Montrose
. dec 19
The Sandy Banana neither loses the peanut nor goes overboard on the Elvis sandwich kick. The peanut has the sharpness you’d expect in a Thai curry sauce, while the banana smooths out the back end. Rye is a nice spirit for the Sandy Banana, as it keeps the drink’s edges even as they fade, making it a tropical treat that never tastes like dessert.
Nailing the laid-back rum bar that also wants to showcase the thrill of a mixologist’s skillset is hard to do. Do customers want to simply relax out in the palapa, or would they rather belly up to the bar and ask questions about hard-to-find Jamaican liquor? The Toasted Coconut proves both can be done in one place, and best yet, the weather is perfect for it.
Peanut, Banana, and Delicate Balance at The Toasted Coconut
. Nov 19
Houston loves a tiki bar, especially one as creative and detail-oriented as the Toasted Coconut.
2019 Eater Awards - Finalist for Best Bar
. Oct 19
The menu is full of shareable plates such as
Jerk Chicharones
,
Sichuan Pork dumplings
and varieties of
“Skewerz“
, such as
Thai Beef Tenderloin
or our personal favorite,
Reverse Pastor
: al pastor-style marinated chunks of pineapple wrapped in bacon. Larger plates include a
Whole Fish with Mala Sauce
,
Baja-Style Mussels
with guajillo chili and either a half or whole order of
Grandma’s Hot Chicken
. “Thailand, Vietnam—basically if it touches the 20th parallel, we’ll work it into the kitchen,” said Stayer.
Troxell’s cocktail menu is split into three categories
—Refreshing & Slam-able, Tropical & Bright
and
Big N’ Boozy
— and includes classic cocktails as well as remixed versions and plenty of original creations. The
Vamos A La Playa
combines Del Maguey Vida mezcal, Uruapan Charanda blended rum, pineapple shrub and lime juice (and went down entirely too easily on a warm summer evening).
The Seaward
will grab your attention from across the restaurant. It’s a mix of Rhum J.M. blanc, coconut water, lime juice, mint and falernum (a Caribbean liqueur) served in a coconut.
Music is key to the vibe, and audiophiles will be happy to hear that the vintage speakers and large vinyl collection for which Nobie’s is known have made their way to Toasted Coconut as well. Expect to hear a fun mix of Exotica Tiki music with plenty of reggae and, of course, Phish.
First Bite: Toasted Coconut Melds Vibrant Tiki Style With a Full Menu.
Sept 19
The menu consists of mostly sharable plates such as the Not so Queso (a peanut dip served with roti), skewers (leg of lamb and Thai beef are both particularly good), and dumplings that have thin skins with savory, satisfying fillings of either Sichuan pork or butter chicken. Sweet and spicy fried chicken will satisfy those with larger appetites.
Troxell’s cocktails are lighter, more refreshing takes on classic tiki drinks; none of them are as overwhelmingly boozy as at a dedicated tiki temple like Lei Low. Start with the Low Tide, a spin on the classic Mai Tai, or the Seaward, which is served in a coconut.
On the bar-restaurant spectrum, full service makes it more of a restaurant than a place like Better Luck Tomorrow, but the snacky menu makes it more of a bar than La Lucha. It’s hard to imagine coming here just for the food, but very easy to think about spending a day sipping cocktails under the palapa.
1617 Richmond Ave.
Where to eat in Houston right now: 10 best new restaurants for fall.
Sept 19
Houston
The Toasted Coconut
What:
A tiki bar and restaurant inspired by tropical cuisines north of the 20th parallel.
Who:
Martin Stayer, Sara Stayer, Ben Ruiz, Sarah Troxell
Where:
Montrose
When:
September 5
Why it’s important:
The team from Nobie’s opens a second concept, focusing on Caribbean and Southeast Asian cuisine. Bar director Sarah Troxell draws inspiration from tiki classics, while also looking beyond the tropical canon to include low-ABV options and less-conventional spirits.
The Most Notable New Bars in America, Fall/Winter 2019.
Sept 19
The menu is full of shareable plates such as
Jerk Chicharones
,
Sichuan Pork dumplings
and varieties of
“Skewerz“
, such as
Thai Beef Tenderloin
or our personal favorite,
Reverse Pastor
: al pastor-style marinated chunks of pineapple wrapped in bacon. Larger plates include a
Whole Fish with Mala Sauce
,
Baja-Style Mussels
with guajillo chili and either a half or whole order of
Grandma’s Hot Chicken
. “Thailand, Vietnam—basically if it touches the 20th parallel, we’ll work it into the kitchen,” said Stayer.
Troxell’s cocktail menu is split into three categories
—Refreshing & Slam-able, Tropical & Bright
and
Big N’ Boozy
— and includes classic cocktails as well as remixed versions and plenty of original creations. The
Vamos A La Playa
combines Del Maguey Vida mezcal, Uruapan Charanda blended rum, pineapple shrub and lime juice (and went down entirely too easily on a warm summer evening).
The Seaward
will grab your attention from across the restaurant. It’s a mix of Rhum J.M. blanc, coconut water, lime juice, mint and falernum (a Caribbean liqueur) served in a coconut.
First Bite: Toasted Coconut Melds Vibrant Tiki Style With a Full Menu.
Sept 19
Montrose restaurant and bar,
Toasted Coconut
, presents a chef-curated menu (think jerk chicharrones and fried chicken) and tiki-inspired bar program. Sips include the Jamaica Me Crazy with lime-flavored vodka, hibiscus, cherry, lime, and sparkling mineral water and the Low Tide with oloroso sherry, Jamaican rum, pecan orgeat, orange curacao, lime and bitters.
Where to eat and drink in Montrose and Midtown right now.
Sept 19
A new tiki bar has opened its doors in the neighborhood. Called
The Toasted Coconut
, the fresh arrival is located at 1617 Richmond Ave. in Montrose.
The Toasted Coconut serves traditional tiki drinks and tropical, island-inspired fare. The menu features international dishes like Thai cripsy rice, Baja-style mussels, jerk chicharones, whole fish with Mala sauce and skewered, grilled meats. Specialty cocktails can come in
your choice
of a vintage mug, glassware or a fresh coconut.
New Montrose tiki bar The Toasted Coconut opens its doors
. Sept 19
Toasted Coconut
, 1617 Richmond:
Chef Martin and Sara Stayer, and beverage director Sarah Troxell
— the team behind the acclaimed
Nobie’s
— have opened tiki-inspired,
Toasted Coconut
.  While some might expect it to be a bar, it is a full-service restaurant with both shareable plates and full-sized entrées to dine on while sipping tropically inspired concoctions. Chef de cuisine
Ben Ruiz
offers dishes such as
Eggplant in Vadouvan curry
and
marinated cucumber salad
which really deliver on both taste and presentation — especially the spicy, crispy eggplant. Those in the mood for full-on dinner fare can enjoy the
Whole Fish with Mala sauce
(which can easily feed 2 people) and the
Baja Style Mussels
with guajillo and cilantro.
On the cocktail side, Troxell is debuting brand-new drinks such as the exquisitely boozy
Sherry Sells Seashells By The Seashore
with reposado tequila, manzanilla sherry, apricot and bitters, and
The Seaward
with Rhum J.M. blanc, coconut water, lime, mint and falernum.
The Hit List: New Houston Restaurants to Visit in September 2019
.
The Toasted Coconut, a bar and restaurant drawing on tiki and tropical inspirations, opened Sept. 5 at 1617 Richmond Ave., Houston. Owned by husband and wife Chef Martin Stayer and Sara Stayer of Nobie’s Restaurant, Toasted Coconut offers a menu that includes shareable plates and larger dishes, in addition to a full bar offering 17 custom cocktails, craft beer and more.
Toasted Coconut brings tiki-inspired cocktails and dishes to Montrose
. Sept 19
The restaurant
shared
on Instagram yesterday: “It’s official!
@gettoastedhtx
IS NOW OPEN at 4PM everyday except Tuesdays!!!” The tiki bar is serving up cocktails with ingredients like rum and coconut water along with wine and beer, and there’s plenty to eat here too. The Toasted Coconut’s menu is focused on food from the 20th parallel north, which lends itself to crispy Thai rice, dumplings, and skewers.
It’s Tiki Time at the Toasted Coconut, Now Open at Richmond Avenue.
Sept 19
The Toasted Coconut is in the space of the former Maria Selma, and the Stayers kept the palapa that defined that Mexican spot. There’s a patio with a waterfall, plus a neighboring “adult sandbox” called Cinnamon Cove.
But we’re not just talking about a bar here—the Toasted Coconut is a full restaurant with a kitchen run by Ben Ruiz, who spent the last eight years in Chicago. He has come south to serve as chef de cuisine at the Toasted Coconut, and leads a menu inspired by cuisines of the 20th parallel north (India, Thailand, Vietnam, Philippines, Mexico, Cuba). Items—small bites and larger plates—include a variety of dumplings, skewered foods, Thai crispy rice, whole fish with Mala sauce, Baja-style mussels, and Grandma’s hot chicken.
The well-appointed bar is run by Nobie’s bar director Sarah Troxell, who is going deep on low ABV and balanced cocktails, while also trying to open up hearts and minds on the versatility of rum. Don’t worry—large-format cocktails and boozier offerings are available. Look for the Seaward (Rhum J.M. blanc, coconut water, lime, mint, falernum) and Low Tide (oloroso sherry, Stolen overproof Jamaican rum, pecan orgeat, orange
curacao
, lime, bitters) among others, presented in vintage tiki mugs, coconuts, and other kinds of glassware.
Along with that, the beer and wine list curated by Sara Stayer focuses on bitter and floral IPAs, plus easy-drinking lagers like Pacifico, Tecate, and the rice-based Yuzu Lager from Japan. All wines are served by the glass.
The Toasted Coconut Aims to Be Your Tropical Playground.
SEPT 19
The Toasted Coconut
, 1617 Richmond, opened September 4.  This is the second concept for husband and wife duo, Chef Martin Stayer and Sara Stayer, of Nobie’s Restaurant. The full service restaurant claims to be the first tiki-ispired concept in Houston to offer a chef-curated menu.
Bar Director Sarah Troxell has created a cocktail menu inspired by her enthusiasm for the tiki culture, which will include 17 libations using various liquors and other spirits bases including some low ABV options. Cocktails like Jamaica Me Crazy with Absolut Lime, hibiscus, cherry, lime, and Topo Chico or the Low Tide, with Oloroso sherry, Stolen Overproof Jamaican rum, pecan
orgeat
, orange
curacao
, lime and bitters will transport Houstonians from the streets of Montrose to the beaches of Maui. The waterfall feature will help as well. Troxell will focus on using fresh juices, shrubs and homemade liqueurs in the cocktails. Drinks will be presented in vintage tiki mugs, coconuts or fun glassware with unique garnishes. Tiki-inspired cocktails will be a highlight of the bar program, but there are plenty of classic mixed drinks and spirits available as well.
Toasted Coconut Debuts.
SEPT 19
Inside, the design features Polynesian masks, custom furniture, and a vintage poster from the movie She Gods of Shark Reef. A small portion of the 2,850-square-foot interior has been devoted to "the cool kid's lounge," which features an astroturf floor and beach chairs.
On the menu, chef Stayer and chef de cuisine Ben Ruiz have created a menu inspired by the countries within 20 degrees north or south of the Equator. Some favorites from the Toasty Tuesdays preview pop-ups made it to the final menu, including three kinds of dumplings, pineapple pastor skewers, and mapo tofu waffles fries. Additions to the menu include more skewers (beef, lamb, chicken, mushroom, and coconut shrimp), salads, and bar snacks. Larger format entrees include fried chicken, whole fish with mala sauce, and vegan chickpea curry with roti and fried cauliflower.
Troxell, the reigning
CultureMap Tastemaker Awards
bartender of the year, takes a lighter, slightly less boozy approach to traditional tiki drinks — although most are still served in tiki mugs, coconuts, or vintage glassware. The Low Tide (oloroso sherry, Stolen overproof Jamaican rum, pecan orgeat, etc.) is a refreshing take on the Mai Tai. In addition to rum-based drinks, patrons will find a couple of tequila cocktails, including the Resting Beach Face, a bottled cocktail that must be shaken prior to drinking. Of course, the bar can still make simple highballs (Jack and Coke, vodka-soda, etc.) for those who want to stick to familiar flavors.
Cool new tiki-themed restaurant serves up tropical vibes in Montrose.
SEPT 19
WHEN YOU STEP INTO THE TOASTED COCONUT
—the new tiki bar from
Nobie
’s owners Martin and Sara Stayer, set to open this summer at the former Maria Selma location on Richmond—order Sarah Troxell’s The Lost Word.
The drink is made with fresh-sugar-cane-derived rhum agricole, passion fruit liqueur, green chartreuse, and lime juice; served in a coupe glass; and garnished with a lime wedge, maraschino cherry, and paper umbrella. It carries a tart punch, earthy, grassy notes, and a subtle sweetness. Nothing overpowers.
“We’re looking to bring different spirits to the party,” says Troxell, who will most certainly rock one of her many Hawaiian shirts while mixing up cocktails. “A lot of tiki cocktails obviously focus on rum and sugar-cane spirits, which I love. But bringing things like tequila and mezcal and gin and whiskey and brandy and your off-the-beaten-path spirits to a tropical, beachy environment is definitely something we’re excited to do.”
The Toasted Coconut Promises a Tropical Getaway in Montrose
. July 19
Is it getting toasty in here, or is it just us? Answer: it definitely is, thanks to chef
Martin Stayer
and sommelier Sara Stayer and bar manager Sarah Troxell, the masterminds behind Nobie’s.
It’s a tiki takeover at the formerTexas Shrimp Shack space, with tropical dishes galore, especially dumplings, skewers and other top-notch shareables. Martin Stayer says if it touches the 20th parallel, he’ll work it into the kitchen. The Indonesian “queso” is really roti in a sweet curry sauce, and the Crispy Rice Salad is taken out of the Vietnamese handbook.
As for the drinks — prepare for some mind-numbing, rum-heavy classics like the Painkiller, Mai Tai, Zombie and Planter’s Punch — alongside some Troxell signatures, featuring everything from blended scotch to rhum Agricole from the Caribbean.
Houston’s Best New Bars and Breweries — 9 Hotspots Set to Make a Sizzling Summer Splash.
June 19
Nobie's Restaurant owners chef Martin Stayer and his wife, Sara Stayer, are set to debut The Toasted Coconut, a tiki bar at 1617 Richmond Avenue, in the space that once housed Maria Selma. Tiki bars have seen a resurgence in recent years, including around Houston, but this one promises to be the first with chef-driven food on the menu, too. "It's going to be fun playing with the bright flavors of the Caribbean and Southeast Asia," chef Martin Stayer said in a prepared statement. "I am very excited to provide a great place to hang out regardless of whether you are drinking, eating or both. Let's get toasted, Houston." Expect a late summer debut and a fun design that promises to be reminiscent of a beach bar, but set in Montrose.
Houston's most anticipated restaurant openings for late summer, early fall 2019.
June 19
The team behind Nobie’s — chef Martin Stayer, sommelier Sara Stayer, and bar manager Sarah Troxell — will celebrate their
love of all things tiki
at this Montrose restaurant that replaces Maria Selma’s/Texas Shrimp Shack. The food menu features dishes inspired by countries within 20 degrees of the equator with a focus on shareable items like skewers and dumplings. Cocktails will both pay homage to classics like the Zombie and the Painkiller and offer alternatives that don't rely on rum and sweet juices.
If the recent presence of Peter Jahnke (Tongue-cut Sparrow) behind the bar at Nobie’s is any indication of future staff, the Stayers will launch the concept with a talented, veteran crew. Send positive thoughts for a mid-to-late-July opening.
The 30 most anticipated restaurants, bars, breweries, and food halls opening in Houston this summer
, June 19
Bartender of the Year: Sarah Troxell, Nobie’s
Once upon a time, Troxell cooked on the Eatsie Boys food truck, but stints at Coltivare and Nobie’s have firmly established her as one of the city’s top bartending talents. Her daily libations at Nobie’s always featuring intriguing combinations, and her skills behind the bar propelled her to a win in the regional finals of the prestigious Speed Rack bartending competition.
Houston's best restaurant, chef, and more revealed at 2019 Tastemaker Awards.
Mar 19
Sarah Troxell, Nobie's
Three years of practice and training finally paid off for Troxell
when she won
the South Central finals of the Speed Rack bartending competition to advance to the national finals in Chicago. Win or lose, Troxell is poised for a busy 2019. Later this summer, her affection for all things tiki will reach full bloom when she assumes control of The Toasted Coconut, the new bar and restaurant from Nobie’s owners Sara and Martin Stayer. If the turnout for a recent preview pop-up of tiki drinks and bites is any indication of the excitement surrounding the project, Houstonians can’t wait for Troxell to put her spin on boozy, rum-based drinks.
These 11 crafty bartenders are shaking up Houston's cocktail scene.
Feb 19
Montrose’s Best New Restaurants.
January 19
This spring, a tropical breeze is set to roll through Montrose. Nobie’s chef Martin Stayer will be showing off his take on the tiki theme. The Toasted Coconut, a tiki restaurant and bar, will set up shop at 1617 Richmond Avenue.
Get ready to sip on hurricanes on a sunny 1,500-square-foot patio.
Teaming up with Nobie’s master mixologist Sarah Troxell, Stayer’s new spot is all about the island life, with nods to Southeast Asia and the Caribbean.
Acclaimed Montrose restaurant launching new, tiki-inspired concept in 2019
. December 18
The team behind
Nobie's
— chef-owner Martin Stayer, sommelier and general manager Sara Stayer (Martin's wife), and bar director Sarah Troxell — will open a second restaurant in the spring. Dubbed
The Toasted Coconut
, the new concept will be a tiki-inspired bar and restaurant in the former Maria Selma's/Texas Shrimp Shack space at 1617 Richmond Ave. “It’s going to be fun playing with the bright flavors of the Caribbean and Southeast Asia"
Nobie’s to Open Tiki-Inspired Restaurant, Bar
.  December 18
Now, Martin Strayer, Sara Strayer, and Sarah Troxell of
Nobie’s
are opening their own tiki concept. The Toasted Coconut is anticipated to open at 1617 Richmond Ave. in spring 2019, per a release.
Back To Top

About the Business
At The Kennedy, our mission is to transport guests through time with a unique fusion of classic elegance, exceptional cuisine, and refined ambiance. We are committed to providing an immersive experience where artistry meets culinary delight, blending a rich heritage of premium cocktails, curated dishes, and live piano performances in an intimate, vintage-inspired setting. From day to night, we create an environment that celebrates timeless sophistication, inspiring connection and conversation through every note, sip, and bite. Step into a world of charm and nostalgia at The Kennedy, where every moment is thoughtfully crafted for a memorable experience.

Dress Code
To maintain our elegant atmosphere, we kindly request: No athletic wear, lounge wear, overly casual clothing, or exposed undergarments. No excessively revealing, sheer, or clothing with offensive language, imagery, or odors. No beanies, baseball caps, visors, or bandanas. Collared shirts and/or sport coats for gentlemen are always appreciated.
Management reserves the right to determine compliance. Thank you for helping us create a refined dining experience for all.

raw_text:
Granger's Restaurant | Classic-Inspired Upscale Dining In The Museum District
Now Serving Brunch Saturday and Sunday from 10 AM to 3 PM, Call
(713) 529-1444
For Reservations
Menu
Reservations

Location
Private Events
Parking
Menu
Order Online
Reservations
Order Catering
\
Private Events
Location
Parking
Work With Us
Our Menu
Savor the flavors of the Gulf Coast and beyond with our classic-inspired menu. Indulge in the
                    freshest catches from our raw bar, featuring succulent oysters and decadent caviar. Our expertly
                    prepared steaks are sure to satisfy, while our comforting favorites like pork chops and French dip
                    sandwiches offer a taste of home. Complete your meal with a selection from our extensive wine and
                    champagne list.
Dine In
Happy Hour
Brunch
Wine/Champaigne
Chef Manny Velasquez is a culinary leader whose journey from humble beginnings in his mother’s
                    kitchen has grown into a distinguished career in hospitality and cuisine. Inspired by the rich
                    traditions of Latin cooking, he has cultivated a style that blends cultural heritage with global
                    influences—creating bold, vibrant, and delicious dishes.
With experience at some of the nation’s most recognized restaurant groups and hotel brands—including
                    Landry’s Seafood, The Cheesecake Factory, and Marriott Hotels—Chef Manny has earned a reputation for
                    creativity, precision, and consistency. His philosophy is simple yet powerful: food should not only
                    nourish but also connect people, reflecting his belief that to eat well is to live well.
Today, Chef Manny serves as Executive Director of Culinary at Granger’s Restaurant in Houston’s
                    Museum District. Collaborating closely with Mr. Granger, he curates menus that highlight the very
                    best of American cuisine, with a focus on premium steaks and fresh seafood. He emphasizes
                    sustainability, local sourcing, and ethical practices—values that shine through in every plate
                    served.
Known for his creativity and attention to detail, Chef Manny continues to push culinary boundaries
                    while honoring tradition. His passion for meaningful experiences and dedication to excellence have
                    established him as a respected innovator in today’s evolving culinary world.
We'll See You Here!
Treat yourself to a culinary journey through classic-inspired dishes with a modern twist. Make your
                    reservation below and explore our menu featuring fresh Gulf seafood, expertly prepared steaks,
                    exquisite oysters and caviar, and comforting favorites like pork
                    chops and French dip sandwiches.

Our chefs source high-end products like Wagyu beef, prepared with local, fresh ingredients to present flavorful dishes with sophisticated plating. Come to Hearsay with the expectation of all the classic elements of fine dining, but enjoy them in a laid back, casual atmosphere.

Our chefs source high-end products like Wagyu beef, prepared with local, fresh ingredients to present flavorful dishes with sophisticated plating. Come to Hearsay with the expectation of all the classic elements of fine dining, but enjoy them in a laid back, casual atmosphere.

tom’s watch bar menu
Game-Day Eats, Elevated – From fan-favorite classics to bold, chef-driven flavors, our menu is crafted to satisfy every craving.
‹
Starters & Snacks
Tom’s Most Popular
Jumbo Wings
Burgers & Sandwiches
Tacos
Bowls
Greens
Sides
Beverages
Cocktails
Beer, Wine & More
›
Starters & Snacks
Kick off your meal with various appetizers design for sharing or enjoying solo, perfect for pairing with drinks or the main course.
AHI TUNA LETTUCE WRAPS*
Crisp lettuce cups filled with marinated ahi tuna, avocado, pineapple, wonton strips, and black sesame seeds. Served with sriracha mayo and teriyaki glaze on the side
AHI TUNA POKE NACHOS*
Marinated ahi tuna, avocado, fresh jalapenos, wonton chips, drizzled with sriracha mayo and teriyaki glaze, topped with black sesame seeds and green onions
Add On:
Truffle Oil
Ahi Tuna Tower
Marinated ahi tuna with sticky rice, avocado, black sesame seeds, and crispy onions topped with a drizzle of truffle oil
Cheese Curds
Fried cheese curds with a side of marinara and ranch dressing
Chips & Queso
Creamy southwest queso served with fresh tortilla chips
Crispy Calamari
Golden-fried calamari and pepperoncini peppers topped with garlic aioli and parsley, served with tangy marinara
CRISPY DILL PICKLES
Crispy pickle chips, buttermilk ranch dressing
DEEP-DISH ADOBO CHICKEN NACHOS
Layers of tortilla chips, flavorful adobo chicken, southwest queso, pico de gallo, jalapeños, guacamole, and sour cream
DEEP-DISH CARNE ASADA STEAK NACHOS
Layers of tortilla chips, tender carne asada, southwest queso, pico de gallo, jalapeños, guacamole, and sour cream
Hummus Duo
Traditional and red pepper hummus topped with pico de gallo and extra virgin olive oil, crumbled feta, served with carrots, celery, and pita bread
Loaded Fries or Tots
Fries or tots smothered in southwest queso, topped with crispy bacon and green onions
Potstickers
Asian-glazed chicken and vegetable potstickers on a bed of shredded cabbage with green onions
Spinach Artichoke Dip
Creamy blend of spinach, artichokes, and cheese, served with fresh tortilla chips
Triple Dips
Guacamole, salsa, and queso served with fresh tortilla chips
Tom’s Most Popular
Discover fan-favorite dishes that keep guests coming back. With a variety of delicious options, there’s something to satisfy every appetite.
APPLEWOOD BACON THREE CHEESE CAVATAPPI PASTA BAKE
Cavatappi pasta smothered in a velvety cream sauce, topped with melted American, Monterey Jack, and cheddar cheeses, oven-baked and loaded with crispy, chopped applewood smoked bacon
Add On:
Truffle Oil
BUFFALO CHICKEN THREE CHEESE CAVATAPPI PASTA BAKE
Cavatappi pasta smothered in a velvety cream sauce, topped with melted American, Monterey Jack, and cheddar cheeses, oven-baked and finished with our hand-battered crispy chicken tenders tossed in Buffalo sauce
Add On:
Truffle Oil
Crispy Chicken & Cornbread Pancake
Sweet cornbread pancakes, pickle-brined and hand-battered premium crispy chicken tenders, honey butter, maple syrup
FISH & CHIPS
Beer-battered whitefish with fries and a side of coleslaw
FULL RACK BABY BACK RIBS
A massive full rack of tender, slow-smoked pork loin back ribs, glazed with a sweet and savory BBQ sauce. Served with mac & cheese and coleslaw
GOLDEN FRIED SHRIMP
Beer-battered golden-fried shrimp with tartar and cocktail sauce served with seasoned fries or tots
HALF RACK BABY BACK RIBS
A hearty half rack of tender, hardwood smoked baby back pork ribs, glazed with a sweet and savory BBQ sauce. Served with mac & cheese and coleslaw
Nashville Hot Jumbo Crispy Chicken Tenders
Crispy pickle-brined premium chicken tenders tossed in Nashville Hot sauce, hand battered in Texas-style breading, served with choice of fries or tots
Pickle-Brined Jumbo Crispy Chicken Tenders
Crispy pickle-brined premium chicken tenders, hand battered in Texas-style breading, served with choice of fries or tots
THREE CHEESE CAVATAPPI PASTA BAKE
Cavatappi pasta smothered in velvety cream sauce, topped with melted American, Monterey Jack, and cheddar cheeses, then oven-baked to a bubbly, golden finish
Add On:
Truffle Oil
TOM’S FAMOUS PRIME RIB DIP
Shaved prime rib, Havarti cheese, horseradish cream, toasted brioche roll with a side of demi-glace, your choice of fries or tots
Jumbo Wings
8 wings served with fresh carrots, celery & choice of ranch or blue cheese.
Buffalo
Tossed in our tangy and spicy original Buffalo sauce
Honey bbq
Coated in Tom’s sweet and smoky honey BBQ sauce
Jamaican jerk
Authentic island-style sauce with bold, spicy-sweet flavor
Korean BBQ
Korean-style sauce with sweet heat, garlic, and seasoning. Topped with sesame seeds
Nashville Hot
Hot and tangy Southern sauce with signature Nashville kick. Topped with dill pickle chips
Burgers & Sandwiches
All burgers and sandwiches are served with your choice of fries or tots.
All-American Burger*
Angus beef, double American cheese, mustard, ketchup, and pickles on a toasted brioche bun
Add On:
Bacon
Bacon Avocado Burger*
Angus beef, bacon, avocado, cheddar cheese, mayo, lettuce, tomato, and onion on a toasted brioche bun
Crispy Buffalo Chicken Sandwich
Pickle-brined and hand-battered crispy chicken tossed in our original Buffalo sauce, topped with cabbage on a toasted brioche bun, ranch on the side
Add On:
Bacon
CRISPY CALIFORNIA CHICKEN CLUB
Premium pickle-brined crispy chicken, bacon, avocado, cheddar, mayo, lettuce & tomato on a toasted brioche bun
GRILLED CALIFORNIA CHICKEN CLUB
Premium pickle-brined grilled chicken, bacon, avocado, cheddar, mayo, lettuce & tomato on a toasted brioche bun
IMPOSSIBLE™ BURGER
Plant-based patty, lettuce, tomato, and onion, served on a vegan bun
Tacos
Two tacos served with fresh chips, queso and salsa. Choice of corn or flour tortilla.
Adobo Seasoned Chicken Tacos
Flavorful adobo chicken with avocado, shredded cabbage, diced onions, and queso fresco
Carne Asada Steak Tacos
Carne asada steak with avocado, shredded cabbage, diced onions, and queso fresco
